definitions.definition: A sensation, pleasant or unpleasant, detected by inhaling air (or, the case of water-breathing animals, water) carrying airborne molecules of a substance.
definitions.example: I love the smell of fresh bread.

definitions.definition: A conclusion or intuition that a situation is wrong, more complex than it seems, or otherwise inappropriate.
To sense a smell or smells.
Followed by like or of if descriptive: to have a particular smell, whether good or bad.
(without a modifier) To smell bad; to stink.
To have a particular tincture or smack of any quality; to savour.
To detect or perceive; often with out.
